You guys have to remember that THIS IS STILL IN ALPHA. This shit ain't even beta yet. There's not going to be much graphical difference; this is the attempt to make a competitor to iOS - something that can run on tablets, phones and PCs with full compatibility across hardware. They were smart because they've correctly anticipated the end of differences between phones, tablets and computers. We're heading back to the future of PDAs. One device that does everything from running our porn, music and videogames to making calls to being firmware-level compatible with massive databases and internet backbones. They want to cut into Linux's high-tech market (not likely) and use the Live metabrand to create UI-level cross-compatibility with the Zune, xBox and Windows. 

Run it in a sandbox or Xen if you can because this shit will mess up your computer if you don't know what you're doing - hence, alpha. 

It still says 7 because they haven't re-branded it, they're still trying to get the cross-platform emulation and new filesystem (about goddamn time) working and all the new little juicy tidbits that haven't been talked about yet. Then they will work on the new graphics system and backwards compatibility with hardware and software, then do a quick branding. 

Stable release 1 loose estimate by the build team: Q3 2012. 

There's a ways to go yet, but it looks solid so far.

After successfully installation completed in VirtualBox, the system continuously crashed after rebooting. Do you have any thoughts on what the problem is? I would like to get this setuo and running in VirtualBox.

So install went well. Boots in 21 seconds post-install, same as 7. Internet Explorer and update wouldn't function for me, It is still registry based despite what I had heard about 8. Google Chrome installed and worked well. It is polished better than 7, 35 processes with 768 mb ram being used in default state at idle. Not bad for Alpha, sound,internet,keyboard,mouse worked OOB. May try to install gfx driver and a game like Fear 3 or WOW to see if/how it'll run.
